text: A Lament and Call to Repentance
Hear this word that I \add am\add* going to intone over you \add as\add* a lament, O house of Israel!
Virgin Israel has fallen and will not rise again. She is deserted on her land; there is no one to raise her up.

For thus says my Lord Yahweh, “The city that marches out \add with\add* a thousand will \add only\add* have a hundred left. And the one that marches out \add with\add* a hundred will \add only\add* have ten left for the house of Israel.”
For thus says Yahweh to the house of Israel, “Seek me so that you may live.”
But do not seek Bethel or go \add to\add* Gilgal or cross over to Beersheba, for Gilgal will certainly go into exile and Bethel will come to disaster.”

Seek Yahweh so that you may live, so that he will not break out like a fire \add against\add* the house of Joseph! And it will devour, ⸤with none to quench⸥\f + \fr 5:6 \ft Literally “and there is not one to quench” \f* \add it\add* for Bethel.
\add Ah,\add* you who turn justice into wormwood and hurl righteousness to the ground!

The one who made the Pleiades and Orion and who turns deep darkness into the morning and darkens day \add into\add* night, the one who calls for the waters of the sea and pours them out on the surface of the earth, Yahweh \add is\add* his name!
The one who makes destruction flash upon \add the\add* fierce, ⸤so that⸥\f + \fr 5:9 \ft Literally “and” \f* destruction comes upon \add the\add* fortification.
They hate the one who reproves in the gate and they abhor the one who speaks honestly.

Therefore, because you trample on \add the\add* poor and you take a grain tax from them, you built houses of dressed stone, but you will not live in them. You built vineyards of delightfulness, but you will not drink their wine.

For I know your transgressions \add are\add* many and your sins \add are\add* numerous, \add you\add* foes of \add the\add* righteous, those who take a bribe, and ⸤those who⸥\f + \fr 5:12 \ft Literally “they” \f* push aside \add the\add* poor \add ones\add* in the gate!
Therefore, whoever has insight will keep silent in that time, for it \add is\add* a time of evil.
Seek good and not bad in order that you may live, and so Yahweh, the God of hosts, will be with you, as you have said.
Hate evil and love good and establish justice in the gate; perhaps Yahweh, the God of hosts, will be gracious \add to\add* the remnant of Joseph.

Therefore, thus says Yahweh, the God of hosts, my Lord, “In all \add of\add* the public squares \add there will be\add* wailing, and in all \add of\add* the streets \add they will say\add*, ‘Alas, alas, alas!’ They shall call \add the\add* farmers to mourning and \add to\add* wailing, to those who are skilled \add in\add* lamentation.
And in all \add of the\add* vineyards \add there will be\add* wailing, because I will pass in your midst,” says Yahweh.
The Day of Yahweh
Alas, those who desire the day of Yahweh, why \add is\add* this for you the day of Yahweh? It \add will be\add* darkness and not light!
\add It will be\add* as \add if\add* a man fled from a lion and a bear met him; or he went \add into\add* the house and leaned his hand against the wall and a snake bit him.
\add Is\add* not the day of Yahweh darkness and not light, and pitch dark with no brightness in it?
“I hate, I despise your festivals, and I take no delight in your assemblies.
Yes, \add even\add* if you offer me your burnt offerings and grain offerings, I will not accept \add them\add*, and I will not look at the fellowship offerings of your fattened animals.
Remove from me the noise of your songs, and I do not want to hear the melody of your harps!
But let justice roll on like the water, and righteousness like an ever-flowing stream.
Did you bring to me sacrifices and offering\add s\add* those forty years in the desert, O house of Israel?
And you will take up Sikkuth, your king, and Kaiwan, your images, the star of your gods which you made for yourselves.
And I will deport you beyond Damascus,” says Yahweh—the God of hosts \add is\add* his name.
